definitions.definition: To determine with precision; to mark out with distinctness ; to ascertain or exhibit clearly.
examples: the defining power of an optical instrument

definitions.definition: To settle , decide ( an argument etc. )
To express the essential nature of something.
examples: I define myself as a techno-anarchist.
Your past mistakes do not define who you are.

definitions.definition: To state the meaning of a word , phrase, sign, or symbol.
examples: The textbook defined speed as velocity divided by time.

definitions.definition: To describe, explain, or make definite and clear ; used to request the listener or other person to elaborate or explain more clearly his or her intended meaning of a word or expression.
examples: Person 1: Is she good at math? Person 2: Define "good." If you mean if she is faster than the average middle schooler at multiplication, then yes. If you mean if she is able to do multivariable calculus, then no.

definitions.definition: To demark sharply the outlines or limits of an area or concept.
examples: to define the legal boundaries of a property

definitions.definition: To establish the referent of a term or notation .

main_definition: To determine with precision; to mark out with distinctness ; to ascertain or exhibit clearly.
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) To settle , decide ( an argument etc. ) [16th–17th c.]
To express the essential nature of something.
To state the meaning of a word , phrase, sign, or symbol.
To describe, explain, or make definite and clear ; used to request the listener or other person to elaborate or explain more clearly his or her intended meaning of a word or expression.
To demark sharply the outlines or limits of an area or concept.
( mathematics ) To establish the referent of a term or notation .
